Lesson 3: SWOT Analysis

This is just one leadership assessment that gives you a lens to view how you lead at work. Are you focused more on tasks than you are focused on people? Are you able to shift quickly between tasks and people (transactional)? Review the strengths and challenges for each style on the slide.

Leadership Style Strengths Challenges
Task-Oriented
  • High performance
  • Accomplishes goals
  • Clear directions and plans
  • Inflexible "by the book"
  • Impersonal
People-Oriented
  • Emphasizes teamwork
  • Builds trust easily
  • Works to maintain harmony
  • Goals take "back seat"
  • Conflict management
Transactional
  • Able to switch between task and people orientation
  • Balances goals with morale
  • Flexible and fair
  • Burn-out

Once youâ€™ve identified and reflected on your own leadership style, you can use a tool like the SWOT Analysis to identify your strengths and opportunities for leadership growth. Take a moment to use this tool to analyze yourself, your organization, or challenging situations.
